sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Koch island.
message_1:
What is the total length of the Koch island after the 6th iteration if the initial line segment has a length of 1 unit?

(Note: In the Koch island construction, a line segment is replaced by four segments of equal length where the middle two segments form an equilateral triangle.)
message_2:
The Koch island is formed by applying the Koch curve process to each side of an equilateral triangle. In each iteration, the length of the curve increases by a factor of 4/3. After the 6th iteration, the length of each side of the Koch island will be:

Initial length * (4/3)^6
1 * (4/3)^6 = 4096/729 ≈ 5.619

Since the Koch island is an equilateral triangle, it has three sides. Therefore, the total length of the Koch island after the 6th iteration is:

3 * 5.619 ≈ 16.857
